Tags: disjunction-introduction-2 python declaration class

DisjunctionIntroduction2Declaration (python class)

See also

math concept | python inclusion class | python sample

This section presents the DisjunctionIntroduction2Declaration python class.

This class models the declaration of the disjunction-introduction-2 inference-rule in the target universe-of-discourse.

Punctilious users do not need to instanciate objects from this class. In effect, the UniverseOfDiscourse class exposes the disjunction_introduction_2 property, and instanciation is automatic when the property is accessed for the first time.

class punctilious.DisjunctionIntroduction2Declaration(universe_of_discourse, echo=None)

The declaration of the disjunction-introduction-2 inference-rule as valid in the target universe-of-discourse .

compose_paragraph_proof(o)

Composes the paragraph-proof of inferred-statements based on the disjunction-introduction-2 inference-rule .

Return type:

Generator[Composable, Composable, bool]

infer_formula(p, q, t, echo=None)

Apply the disjunction-introduction-2 inference-rule and return the resulting formula.

Parameters:

  • p – (mandatory) A formula-statement of the form \(P\) .

  • q – (mandatory) A formula of the form \(Q\) .

  • t – (mandatory) The target theory-elaboration-sequence that must contain \(P\) .

  • echo –

Returns:

The resulting formula \(\left( P \lor Q \right)\) .

verify_args(p, q, t)

Verify the correctness of the parameters provided to the double-negation-introduction inference-rule .

Parameters:

  • p – (mandatory) A formula-statement of the form \(P\) .

  • q – (mandatory) A formula of the form \(Q\) .

  • t – (mandatory) The target theory-elaboration-sequence that must contain \(P\) .

Returns:

True (bool) if the parameters are correct.
